embeds.title: Mob Leader's Crown
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / The Gremlins / Downfall

Replaces Mob Leader's Staff.
The first time you shuffle your draw pile each turn, gain :energy_gremlins: , draw 1 card, and Swap to the next Gremlin.
*The fancier the symbol of office, the more likely it is to be stolen.*

messages.content: but holy water
is pretty good
it's not the greatest
but it's good
but I'm not a watcher expert so I'm sure you can do something insane with it
like nuclear battery stuff
this is a very silly relic, your playing an offclass card every turn by act 2 (the soonest you can get this) so its basically just an energy relic with no downside 99% of the time.
you lose out on drawing a single card from your starter relic; but thats a really trivial price to pay as well.
about mob leader's crown
I think you can do things with it, sometimes
ultimate crown is just not good
the whole point of champions crown is being able to play execute no matter where it is in the draw pile with no prep beforehand
victorious crown's purpose is to gain a bunch of str on turn 1
ultimate crown makes it so that if you don't draw execute turn 1 you need to prep it
and also it acts like a giant anchor
obviously if you spam a ton of moment of truth you could do something really dumb with it but that's playing with expectations
it's very "build into"
I think mob leader's is also "build into", but a little less.
And you're still only going to have 3 energy with ultimate crown, and champ needs a 4th energy IMO.
Well needs is a strong word
but w/e
really wants is a better term
yeah
a ton of his best cards are 2 costs.

A very powerful boss relic, pretty close to a "free" 4th energy, considering that snecko already starts the run with 2 unidentified starters, and you usually need to pick up more to get you through act 1 (unidentified attacks, unidentified vulnerable, etc.) Worth noting that in fights like the three heroes, and neow, you are given playable curses, and those count as offclass cards too. You could also pick up a playable curse from an event like world of goop, purifier, or suspicious house, and they would count as offclass cards. Medkit and bronze idol can help turn enemy statuses into playable cards as well, which works with super snecko soul. By trading out your starter relic, you just lose out on 1 card draw, which matters, but isn't that significant next to getting the 4th energy.

I suppose that in some ways, this is pretty similar to idol of retromation, in that you get the 4th energy, but you don't get to choose where you spend it, since you need to play an offclass card to trigger it. Considering how frequently snecko's strategy devolves into spamming tons of cards, often with muddle to make as many of them cost 0 or 1 as possible, this is a pretty insignificant drawback. If you have master eye or snecko eye, there's a decent chance that you will draw an offclass card and get it set to 0 or 1 and be pretty free to spend your 4th energy as you see fit. Cheap stock can also be used with super snecko soul to help play those offclass card more cheaply. You could also use unending supply to ensure having an offclass card every turn, but I usually don't find that to be an issue. Essentially, it takes very little effort to do what super snecko soul is asking you to do, and the reward is fantastic. The presence of super snecko soul makes boss swapping worse for snecko. Your starter relic is already pretty fantastic in the early game as a lantern/half a bag of preparation, and cutting yourself off from such a strong upgraded version is also rough.
